title: How to start and sell in an MLM - Quora

response.answer_text: You shouldn’t just start any mlm, and mlm is only a description of the model of how it expands. You have to find a company and product that you have an emotional attachment, not just because you saw a an mlm plan and think you can make lots of money, you need to believe in the benefits of the product from personal use or someone close to you. Also research the company to make sure it is ethical - on line research with little negativity, in business for over 5 years, growing and strong financially. In summary, if you think what they promote can help a lot of people, then you are not selling but helping them make a good choice.

Someone in MLM must sponsor you into their business. Most people discover mlm thru a family member, friend or social contact. Most people (96%) fail at mlm. So your wise choice would be to seek out someone who beat the odds and is a in the top 4%. Finding this person might be a touch more difficult than finding a winning slot machine in a Los Vegas casino room. I would focus on learning the reasons why most people fail at mlm and then you will be better prepared to evaluate WHO you will join and with what company. Don Failla is the Author of the number one All Time Best Seller ever on the subject of MLM and the first four chapters of his book are free below: The Secret To Online Network Marketing Success Live long and prosper
